elements.title: Like-minded sources on Facebook are prevalent but not polarizing (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Like-minded sources on Facebook are prevalent but not polarizing

A large-scale field intervention experiment on 23,377 US Facebook users during the 2020 presidential election shows that reducing exposure to content from like-minded social media sources has no measurable effect on political polarization or other political attitudes and beliefs.

  • Brendan Nyhan
  • Jaime Settle
  • Joshua A. Tucker
ArticleOpen Access27 Jul 2023

elements.title: Oligomerization-mediated activation of a short prokaryotic Argonaute (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Oligomerization-mediated activation of a short prokaryotic Argonaute

  • Zhangfei Shen
  • Xiao-Yuan Yang
  • Tian-Min Fu
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Thermodynamic evidence of fractional Chern insulator in moiré MoTe2 (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Thermodynamic evidence of fractional Chern insulator in moiré MoTe2

  • Yihang Zeng
  • Zhengchao Xia
  • Jie Shan
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Reply to: Re-evaluating evidence for adaptive mutation rate variation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Reply to: Re-evaluating evidence for adaptive mutation rate variation

  • J. Grey Monroe
  • Kevin D. Murray
  • Detlef Weigel
Matters ArisingOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Re-evaluating evidence for adaptive mutation rate variation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Re-evaluating evidence for adaptive mutation rate variation

  • Long Wang
  • Alexander T. Ho
  • Sihai Yang
Matters ArisingOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Evolutionary histories of breast cancer and related clones (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Evolutionary histories of breast cancer and related clones

By using phylogenetic analyses of multiple microdissected samples from both cancer and non-cancer lesions, unique evolutionary histories of breast cancers harbouring a common driver alteration are shown, providing new insight into how breast cancer evolves.

  • Tomomi Nishimura
  • Nobuyuki Kakiuchi
  • Seishi Ogawa
ArticleOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Sub-1.4 cm3 capsule for detecting labile inflammatory biomarkers in situ (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Sub-1.4 cm3 capsule for detecting labile inflammatory biomarkers in situ

A biosensor comprising bacteria engineered to respond to transient inflammatory signals has been packaged with electronic readout and transmission circuits in a small device that could be swallowed to monitor gastrointestinal health.

  • M. E. Inda-Webb
  • M. Jimenez
  • T. K. Lu
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Global hotspots of traded phylogenetic and functional diversity (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Global hotspots of traded phylogenetic and functional diversity

Using a global dataset of traded species, it is found that the highest levels of traded phylogenetic and functional diversity are from tropical regions, where high numbers of evolutionary distinct and globally endangered species occur.

  • Liam J. Hughes
  • Mike R. Massam
  • David P. Edwards
ArticleOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Rewiring cancer drivers to activate apoptosis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Rewiring cancer drivers to activate apoptosis

A new class of molecules can recruit downstream transcription factors or endogenous cancer drivers to cell death promoters and activate the expression of these genes.

  • Sai Gourisankar
  • Andrey Krokhotin
  • Gerald R. Crabtree
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Small protein modules dictate prophage fates during polylysogeny (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Small protein modules dictate prophage fates during polylysogeny

 Prophage lysogeny-to-lysis transitions are controlled by regulatory modules consisting of transcription factors and partner small proteins that are activated through DNA-damage-independent pathways, including by quorum sensing, and these modules determine inter-prophage competition outcomes.

  • Justin E. Silpe
  • Olivia P. Duddy
  • Bonnie L. Bassler
ArticleOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Accelerating the energy transition towards photovoltaic and wind in China (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Accelerating the energy transition towards photovoltaic and wind in China

To meet China’s goal of carbon neutrality by 2060, substantial investment in upgrading power systems needs to be made to optimize the deployment of new photovoltaic and wind power plants.

  • Yijing Wang
  • Rong Wang
  • Renhe Zhang
ArticleOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Subsecond periodic radio oscillations in a microquasar (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Subsecond periodic radio oscillations in a microquasar

Two instances of approximately 5-Hz transient periodic oscillation features from the source detected in the 1.05- to 1.45-GHz radio band that occurred in January 2021 and June 2022 are reported.

  • Pengfu Tian
  • Ping Zhang
  • Na Sai
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Extensive pedigrees reveal the social organization of a Neolithic community (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Extensive pedigrees reveal the social organization of a Neolithic community

The burial community at Gurgy ‘les Noisats’ (France) was genetically connected by two main pedigrees, spanning seven generations, that were patrilocal and patrilineal, with evidence for female exogamy and exchange with genetically close neighbouring groups.

  • Maïté Rivollat
  • Adam Benjamin Rohrlach
  • Wolfgang Haak
ArticleOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Neural basis for fasting activation of the hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal axis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Neural basis for fasting activation of the hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal axis

Fasting-activated hypothalamic AgRP-expressing neurons trigger fasting-induced hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal axis activation through projections to the paraventricular hypothalamus, where they activate CRH neurons by presynaptically inhibiting the terminals of tonically active GABAergic afferents from the bed nucleus of the stria terminalis.

  • Amelia M. Douglass
  • Jon M. Resch
  • Bradford B. Lowell
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Evolutionarily divergent mTOR remodels translatome for tissue regeneration (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Evolutionarily divergent mTOR remodels translatome for tissue regeneration

Rapid activation of protein synthesis in the axolotl highlights the unanticipated impact of a translatome on orchestrating the early steps of wound healing and provides a missing link in our understanding of vertebrate regenerative potential.

  • Olena Zhulyn
  • Hannah D. Rosenblatt
  • Maria Barna
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Heat-assisted detection and ranging (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Heat-assisted detection and ranging

Heat-assisted detection and ranging is experimentally shown to see texture and depth through darkness as if it were day, and also perceives decluttered physical attributes beyond RGB or thermal vision.

  • Fanglin Bao
  • Xueji Wang
  • Zubin Jacob
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Rift-induced disruption of cratonic keels drives kimberlite volcanism (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Rift-induced disruption of cratonic keels drives kimberlite volcanism

Most kimberlites erupting in the past billion years on Earth did so about 30 million years after continental breakup, with dynamical and analytical models suggesting a control from rifting-related mantle delamination.

  • Thomas M. Gernon
  • Stephen M. Jones
  • Anne Glerum
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Earth’s evolving geodynamic regime recorded by titanium isotopes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Earth’s evolving geodynamic regime recorded by titanium isotopes

Titanium isotope measurements for chondrites, ancient terrestrial mantle-derived lavas and modern ocean island basalts imply the preservation of a primordial lower-mantle reservoir for most of Earth’s geologic history.

  • Zhengbin Deng
  • Martin Schiller
  • Martin Bizzarro
ArticleOpen Access26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Universal equation of state for wave turbulence in a quantum gas (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Universal equation of state for wave turbulence in a quantum gas

Equilibrium-like state variables, related by an equation of state, are identified in a study of turbulent cascade of matter waves in a far-from-equilibrium ultracold atomic Bose gas.

  • Lena H. Dogra
  • Gevorg Martirosyan
  • Zoran Hadzibabic
Article26 Jul 2023

elements.title: Structure of an endogenous mycobacterial MCE lipid transporter (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Structure of an endogenous mycobacterial MCE lipid transporter

Proteins of the Mycobacterium smegmatis Mce1 system assemble to form an elongated ABC transporter complex that is long enough to span the impermeable mycobacterial cell envelope.

  • James Chen
  • Alice Fruhauf
  • Damian C. Ekiert
Article26 Jul 2023
